content: अधर {%<ab>a.</ab>%} [न ध्रियते; धृ-अच्, न. त.] {@--1@} Lower (<ab>opp.</ab> उत्तर), (<ab>lit.</ab> not held up); tending downwards; under, nether, downward; °वासः under garment <ls>Ki. 4. 38</ls>; <ab>cf.</ab> °अंबर <ls>Śi. 1. 6</ls>; °ओष्ठ lower or nether lip, see below. (In this sense अधर partakes of the character of a pronoun). {@--2@} Low, mean, vile; °उत्तरं See below; lower in quality, inferior. {@--3@} Silenced, worsted, not able to speak; See हीन, हीनवादिन्. {@--4@} Previous, preceding; as in अधरेद्युः, <ab>q. v.</ab> --रः The nether (or sometimes the upper) lip; a lip in general; °पत्रं <ls>Ku. 5. 27</ls> leaf-like lower lip; बिंबाधरालक्तकः <ls>M. 3. 5</ls>; पक्वबिंबाधरोष्ठी <ls>Me. 82</ls>; पिबसि रतिसर्वस्वमधरं <ls>Ś. 1. 24</ls>; <ls n="Ś.">1. 21</ls>, <ls n="Ś.">3. 24</ls>; <ab>cf.</ab> अधरंखलु बिंबनामकं फलमाभ्यमिति भव्यमन्वयम् . लभतेऽधरबिंबैत्यदः पदमस्या रदनच्छदे वदत् .. <ls>N. 2. 24.</ls> --रा The nadir; (अधोदिश्) or the southern direction. --रं {@--1@} The lower part (of the body); पृष्ठवंशाधरे त्रिकं <ls>Ak.</ls> {@--2@} Pudendum Muliebre (also {%<ab>m.</ab>%}). {@--3@} Address, speech (<ab>opp.</ab> उत्तर); statement, sometimes used for reply also.
